step1.sentence: Before you get frustrated over this one setback, try to see the bigger picture and remember how far you've already come.

step2.story: Maya had been obsessing over a single failed presentation for days. Her mentor sat her down and reminded her to look at the bigger picture — her project was still on track and the team still trusted her. That shift in perspective gave her the clarity she needed to move forward.

step3.story: Daniel had spent weeks agonizing over a minor budget overrun on his department's quarterly report. Every small number that didn't add up kept him awake at night, convinced the entire project was a failure. His director called him into her office and spread out a year's worth of performance charts on the desk. 'You're missing the bigger picture,' she said calmly, pointing to a steady upward trend across all key metrics. Daniel stared at the charts and slowly realized the overrun was a tiny blip in an otherwise strong record. He left the meeting feeling relieved, and more importantly, reminded that progress is rarely measured in a single moment.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 말 그대로 '더 큰 그림'을 뜻하며, 세부 사항보다 전체적인 상황이나 맥락을 가리킵니다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 작은 문제나 세부 사항에 집착하지 말고 전체적인 상황, 목표, 혹은 장기적인 관점을 바라보라는 의미로 사용됩니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 그림이나 사진에서 멀리서 볼수록 전체 구도가 보인다는 비유에서 유래했으며, 영어권에서 19세기 이후부터 비유적 의미로 널리 쓰이게 되었습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 주로 누군가가 지나치게 사소한 일에 집중하거나 낙담했을 때 관점을 되찾도록 권유하는 따뜻하고 조언적인 뉘앙스를 가집니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: Stop worrying about one bad grade — look at the bigger picture of your overall progress.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 성적 하나에 너무 연연하지 마 — 전체적인 네 성장의 큰 그림을 봐.
